{{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=20:30, 31 December 2009 |action1link=Talk:SMS Scharnhorst/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=335163738 | action2 =GTC | action2date =18:20, 18 March 2011 (UTC) | action2link = Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Scharnhorst class armored cruisers/archive1 | action2result = Promoted |action3=GTC |action3date=01:53, 21 June 2011 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Armored cruisers of Germany/archive1 |action3result=promoted |ftname=Armored cruisers of Germany |topic=War |dykdate=27 December 2009 |currentstatus=FA |action4=WAR |action4date=21:16, 29 May 2014 (UTC) |action4link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/SMS Scharnhorst |action4result=approved |action4oldid=610346512 |action5=FAC |action5date=08:22, 26 July 2014 |action5link=Wikipedia:Featured_article_candidates/SMS Scharnhorst/archive1 |action5result=not promoted |action5oldid=613908656 |action6=FAC |action6date=14:05, 10 September 2014 |action6link=Wikipedia:Featured_article_candidates/SMS Scharnhorst/archive2 |action6result=promoted |action6oldid=623303948 |four=no |maindate=8 December 2014 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA}} {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|A-Class=pass|German=yes|Maritime=yes|WWI=yes}} {{WikiProject Germany|class=FA|importance=low}} {{ShipwrecksWikiProject|class=FA}} {{WikiProject South America|class=FA|importance=low|Falkland Islands=yes|Falkland Islands-importance=low}} }} ==Intro== The lead paragraph is rather confusing; I'd delete the first mention of Gneisenau as it is easy to think that the latter was the lead ship of the class. Just move the link to the next mention of Gneisenau.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 23:07, 16 December 2009 (UTC) :I reworded it slightly, is it more clear now? [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 02:16, 17 December 2009 (UTC) ::It's fine now.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 04:10, 17 December 2009 (UTC) == Were there survivors or not? == In the '''Outcome''' section of the [[Battle of the Falkland Islands]], it states:
'''Out of the 765 officers and men from the Scharnhorst, only 7 survived.'''
Which clearly conflicts with this article and the DYK mention out front. Who's right? --Cantthinkofausername 07:24, 27 December 2009 (UTC) :First, the figure of 765 officers and men is wrong; that figure is roughly the standard crew of a ''Scharnhorst'' class cruiser (38 officers and 726 enlisted men). As the squadron flagship, ''Scharnhorst'' carried an additional 80-odd officers and crew for the command staff. Second, that claim isn't sourced in the other article, and it is here (to quote Gr√∂ner: "All crew lost"). [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 13:17, 28 December 2009 (UTC) {{/GA1}} == Dreadnought? == Pardon the ignorance, but was this ship a Dreadnought? The article doesn't say, and the evidence is a little unclear... --[[User:Piledhigheranddeeper|Piledhigheranddeeper]] ([[User talk:Piledhigheranddeeper|talk]]) 18:21, 8 December 2014 (UTC) :No, dreadnoughts were "all-big-gun" warships (as a general rule of thumb, anything under 10 inches is categorized as medium caliber for warships). [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 19:02, 8 December 2014 (UTC)
